oai_dc:dc.dc:description: THE NATIONAL WOMAN'S PARTY Several months after the inauguration of President Wilson there was organized in Washington city, "The Congressional Union," by Misses Paul and Burns. The object of this union was to procure the passage of an amendment to the federal constitution looking to the enfranchisement of all citizens of the United States regardless of sex. These young women and many beside recognized that by state enactment alone the women of the whole United States would not be allowed to vote for a hundred years or more. They therefore determined to besiege the national fortress which was controlled iby the democratic party as to the executive as well as both houses of congress. The siege continued during the first term of President Wilson's administration, the besiegers being forced Ito the conclusion that the executive alone was responsible for the refusal of the fortress to surrender. The Congressional Union sent out a call to the women of the west who had votes to come to the aid their eastern and southern sisters. This call met with a generous response and a woman's party was organized by the women voters to work in unison with the Congressional Union for the passage of the federal amendment. You surely will feel ashamed to accept your freedom at the hands of women to whom you have given no help at all. As state chairman it is my duty to appoint a chariman of each congressinal district, who will help me do this by sending in the names of those women who will make good chairmen? It will then be the duty of each congressional chairman to appoint a chairman of each county in her district. Will not those who read this help along the good work by sending in names of a number of women at each county seat who would make good helpers in the cause? Act quickly, lest the cause be gained before you have a chance to lend a helping hand. Miss Carrie Callaway is the secretary and treasurer for the state committee, she will be most happy to receive any donation you would be pleased to send. We desire to open headquarters at Knoxville, help to this end will be most gladly received.
